node.title: Meet the families fighting for voluntary assisted dying in New South Wales
node.description: New South Wales is currently the only state in Australia that doesn't allow terminally ill people to seek medical assistance to end their own lives. These are the stories of some of the people working to change that.
node.content:
["Grandmother Dee Hilton doesn't wish to die, but she prefers death over a painful and prolonged suffering.\u00a0", "The 76-year-old lives with multiple system atrophy (MSA), a terminal condition that she fears will cause a \"horrendous\" end as her symptoms worsen.\u00a0", "\"MSA means all of the systems in your body are dying. So it affects your bladder and your bowel ... and all sorts, everything,\" Ms Hilton said.", "\"Eventually\u00a0my breathing will be affected. It's not going to be an easy death.", "", "
Woollahra resident Dee Hilton lives with multiple system atrophy and wants the right to choose when she dies.(ABC News: Jerry Rickard)
", "Ms Hilton is among thousands calling on the New South Wales government to pass laws to allow terminally ill people to end their own lives with the help of doctors.\u00a0", "She not only fears her own pain, but the suffering of her beloved husband, and now carer, Andrew.\u00a0", "\"I don't want his memory of our beautiful years together be tainted by that,\" she said.\u00a0", "The former high school teacher can picture an alternative in her mind. In her final moments, at a time of her choosing, she wants to gather her family around her.", "\"We'll have some champagne. We'll tell some crazy stories \u2026\u00a0and then it will be just be Andrew and I,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"And I know it'll be hard for him. I know that. But he's such a wonderful man and I know if the boot was on the other foot I would want exactly the same.\"", "Ms Hilton is hoping a new voluntary assisted dying bill in NSW, to allow terminally ill people to end their own lives, will pass.", "", "
Campaigners from Dying with Dignity set up a \"Field of Hearts\"\u00a0installation at The Domain in Sydney.(ABC News: Alison Xiao)
", "Twelve Labor MPs are supporting the bill, along with 12 crossbenchers and four government MPs.", "\"The government does not have the right to tell me when I have to die, how long I can live, what I have to put up with in terms of [my] medical condition or pain.\"\u00a0", "Her hope that the bill would pass this year has\u00a0been dashed, with the Upper House vote on it delayed until 2022.", "The committee will review the legislation, if it passes the Lower House, and will not\u00a0finalise its report until February next year.\u00a0", "The proposed new laws have come too late for some families in NSW.\u00a0", "
Managing the pain 'wasn't enough'\u00a0
", "", "
Ken Dickson lived with a terminal illness before taking his life in 2015. His daughters want voluntary assisted dying legalised.(ABC News: Aaron Hollett)
", "Christine Kelly's father Ken Dickson took his own life in 2015\u00a0after battles with three types of cancers.\u00a0", "\"No matter what we gave him, pain management wise, [it] just wasn't enough,\" Ms Kelly said.", "\"He got down to 45 kilos. He was just a shadow of himself, of what he was. He wasn't the father that we knew and loved anymore. And he just wanted to end the suffering.\"", "When Mr Dickson died in 2015, no jurisdiction in Australia had legalised voluntary assisted dying.", "In a letter to his family, the devout Christian wrote that he felt he had no alternative.", "\"When we found that note that night, I made a promise to Dad that we were going to do whatever we could to help get this [law] through,\" Ms Kelly said.", "New data from the National Coronial Information System reveals one in five people over 40 who took their life in NSW in 2019 had a terminal illness.", "It was a choice Kristin Cornell's father, Allan, almost made.\u00a0", "The father-of-two from Warrnambool in regional Victoria went downhill rapidly after being diagnosed with motor neurone disease, a degenerative illness which eventually leads to paralysis.", "Ms Cornell, an obstetrician, documented her father's final months in a series of audio and video recordings.\u00a0", "In one such video, Allan tells his daughter how he contemplated suicide before realising he was eligible to access voluntary assisted dying.", "", "
Kristin Cornell\u2019s father Allan accessed voluntary assisted dying in Warrnambool, Victoria.(Supplied)
", "\"[It's] not often I sook but you end up in tears, you start thinking about your wife and kids, it's \u2026\u00a0uncomfortable, it's a horrible place to be,\" he says in the recording.\u00a0", "In the same video, he spoke of his relief after learning he could seek medical assistance to end his life.\u00a0", "\"As he said to me that day, 'It allows me to be a better man till the end.'\u00a0And it really did \u2014\u00a0he got a sense of calmness back,\" Ms Cornell said.\u00a0", "In Victoria, the right for a terminally ill person to choose when they die came into effect in June 2019.\u00a0", "Since then, more than 300 people have died from taking medication prescribed by their doctor.\u00a0", "The laws in Victoria allow access to a lethal substance for terminally ill adults who have less than six months to live, or 12 months for neurodegenerative conditions.", "There are\u00a0also other strict eligibility criteria such as being able to give informed consent and being assessed by two doctors who have completed mandatory training.\u00a0", "Allan faced a series of hurdles to access the scheme in a process that took about three months.\u00a0", "", "
Kristin Cornell said her father's \"sense of calmness\" returned when he learned he could access voluntary assisted dying.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Despite the challenges, Ms Cornell said her father had a \"good death\".\u00a0", "\"It's hard to hear those words that someone wants to end their life, but \u2026\u00a0they're not choosing to die, because they're already dying,\" she said.", "NSW is currently the only state in Australia that doesn't allow terminally ill people to seek medical assistance to end their own lives.", "In 2017, the Voluntary Assisted Dying Bill debated was defeated in the Upper House by just one vote.", "Watch this story on 7.30 tonight on ABC TV and iview."]
